insecure.description: Allow insecure HTTPS client. This can also be set as the ACI_INSECURE environment variable. Defaults to true.

logging.description: Enable debug logging. This can also be set as the ACI_LOGGING environment variable. Defaults to false.

password.description: Password for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_PASSWORD environment variable.

retries.description: Number of retries for REST API calls. This can also be set as the ACI_RETRIES environment variable. Defaults to 3.

url.description: URL of the Cisco APIC web interface. This can also be set as the ACI_URL environment variable.

username.description: Username for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_USERNAME environment variable.

description: The Pulumi ACI provider provides resources to interact with a Cisco ACI fabric.
name: aci

insecure.description: Allow insecure HTTPS client. This can also be set as the ACI_INSECURE environment variable. Defaults to true.

logging.description: Enable debug logging. This can also be set as the ACI_LOGGING environment variable. Defaults to false.

password.description: Password for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_PASSWORD environment variable.

retries.description: Number of retries for REST API calls. This can also be set as the ACI_RETRIES environment variable. Defaults to 3.

url.description: URL of the Cisco APIC web interface. This can also be set as the ACI_URL environment variable.

username.description: Username for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_USERNAME environment variable.

insecure.description: Allow insecure HTTPS client. This can also be set as the ACI_INSECURE environment variable. Defaults to true.

logging.description: Enable debug logging. This can also be set as the ACI_LOGGING environment variable. Defaults to false.

password.description: Password for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_PASSWORD environment variable.

retries.description: Number of retries for REST API calls. This can also be set as the ACI_RETRIES environment variable. Defaults to 3.

url.description: URL of the Cisco APIC web interface. This can also be set as the ACI_URL environment variable.

username.description: Username for the APIC Account. This can also be set as the ACI_USERNAME environment variable.

aci:apic:Rest.description: Manages ACI Model Objects via REST API calls. This resource can only manage a single API object.

children.description: List of child objects to be created. Each child object must have a unique relative name.

class_name.description: Which class object is being created. (Make sure there is no colon in the classname)

content.description: Map of key-value pairs those needed to be passed to the Model object as parameters. Make sure the key name matches the name with the object parameter in ACI.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object being managed including its relative name, e.g. uni/tn-EXAMPLE_TENANT.

children.description: List of child objects to be created. Each child object must have a unique relative name.

class_name.description: Which class object is being created. (Make sure there is no colon in the classname)

content.description: Map of key-value pairs those needed to be passed to the Model object as parameters. Make sure the key name matches the name with the object parameter in ACI.

dn.description: Distinguished name of object being managed including its relative name, e.g. uni/tn-EXAMPLE_TENANT.

aci:apic:Child.description: A child object to be created.

class_name.description: Which class object is being created. (Make sure there is no colon in the classname)

content.description: Map of key-value pairs those needed to be passed to the Model object as parameters. Make sure the key name matches the name with the object parameter in ACI.
